books.author: by Demi Moore
books.description: The Hollywood star chronicles the rocky relationships, body image issues and public perceptions that affected her attempts to balance family and fame.
books.name: INSIDE OUT

books.author: by Bill O'Reilly
books.description: The conservative commentator weaves interviews and personal history to portray the power and influence of the 45th president.
books.name: THE UNITED STATES OF TRUMP

books.author: by Malcolm Gladwell
books.description: Famous examples of miscommunication serve as the backdrop to explain potential conflicts and misunderstandings.
books.name: TALKING TO STRANGERS

books.author: by Jonathan Van Ness
books.description: How the hairstylist, comedian and "Queer Eye" star overcame ridicule and trauma.
books.name: OVER THE TOP

books.author: by Chanel Miller
books.description: A sexual assault victim reclaims her identity and challenges our culture and criminal justice system as they relate to this issue.
books.name: KNOW MY NAME

books.author: by Tara Westover
books.description: The daughter of survivalists, who is kept out of school, educates herself enough to leave home for university.
books.name: EDUCATED

books.author: by Edward Snowden
books.description: A memoir by the former National Security Agency contractor who exposed the government’s mass surveillance program.
books.name: PERMANENT RECORD

books.author: by Jim Mattis and Bing West
books.description: The former Marine infantry officer and secretary of defense recounts key moments from his career and imparts his leadership philosophy.
books.name: CALL SIGN CHAOS

books.author: by Garrett M. Graff
books.description: An oral history of the events that occurred on Sept. 11, 2001, based on transcripts, declassified documents and interviews.
books.name: THE ONLY PLANE IN THE SKY

books.author: by Dan Bongino
books.description: The Fox News contributor and former Secret Service agent gives his take on the Mueller investigation.
books.name: EXONERATED

books.author: by Michelle Obama
books.description: The former first lady describes her journey from the South Side of Chicago to the White House, and how she balanced work, family and her husband’s political ascent.
books.name: BECOMING

books.author: by Timothy Snyder
books.description: Twenty lessons from the 20th century about the course of tyranny.
books.name: ON TYRANNY

books.author: by Patti Smith
books.description: A memoir by the musician and artist surveys events during 2016, including a visit to see dying friends and a sea change in the political landscape.
books.name: YEAR OF THE MONKEY

books.author: by Renia Spiegel
books.description: The written confidences and daily life of a Jewish teenager in Poland as the Nazis spread throughout Europe from 1939 to 1942.
books.name: RENIA'S DIARY

books.author: by Jodi Kantor and Megan Twohey
books.description: Two reporters for The New York Times recount their investigation into Harvey Weinstein’s alleged abuses of power and the subsequent global disclosure of women’s traumatic stories.
books.name: SHE SAID
